headline.main: Middle East and Asia Boost Investment in Top Level Sports
headline.print_headline: Middle East and Asia Boost Investment in Top Level Sports

docs.lead_paragraph: A new report has highlighted the growing reach and depth of Asian and Middle-Eastern investment in top-level sports around the world with no sign of any slowdown.
docs.snippet: A new report has highlighted the growing reach and depth of Asian and Middle-Eastern investment in top-level sports around the world with no sign of any slowdown....

headline.main: Storm May Make Roads Slick in Ohio Valley, Northeast
headline.print_headline: Storm May Make Roads Slick in Ohio Valley, Northeast

docs.lead_paragraph: Forecasters are warning motorists to expect slippery roads at the start of the work week as a storm brings freezing rain, sleet and snow from the Ozarks to New England.
docs.snippet: Forecasters are warning motorists to expect slippery roads at the start of the work week as a storm brings freezing rain, sleet and snow from the Ozarks to New England....

headline.main: New Salaries in London's Financial Services Up 18 Percent
headline.print_headline: New Salaries in London's Financial Services Up 18 Percent

docs.lead_paragraph: Workers who found new jobs in London's financial services sector during 2014 secured an average 18 percent salary rise, reflecting increased demand for staff, data from recruiter Morgan McKinley showed on Monday.
docs.snippet: Workers who found new jobs in London's financial services sector during 2014 secured an average 18 percent salary rise, reflecting increased demand for staff, data from recruiter Morgan McKinley showed on Monday....

headline.main: SHOW BITS: Freshening Up for Party Time
headline.print_headline: SHOW BITS: Freshening Up for Party Time

docs.lead_paragraph: Show Bits brings you the 72nd annual Golden Globes in Beverly Hills, California, through the eyes of Associated Press journalists. Follow them on Twitter where available with the handles listed after each item.

headline.main: Lack of Top-Level U.S. Official at Paris March Raises Some Eyebrows at Home
headline.print_headline: Lack of Top-Level U.S. Official at Paris March Raises Some Eyebrows at Home

docs.lead_paragraph: The absence of President Barack Obama or any top members of his administration from a huge march in Paris on Sunday to honor victims of Islamist militant attacks raised eyebrows among some in the U.S. media.
docs.snippet: The absence of President Barack Obama or any top members of his administration from a huge march in Paris on Sunday to honor victims of Islamist militant attacks raised eyebrows among some in the U.S. media....

headline.main: Bryant Left in Disbelief Over Reversed Call on Crucial Catch
headline.print_headline: Bryant Left in Disbelief Over Reversed Call on Crucial Catch

docs.lead_paragraph: Dallas Cowboys wide receiver Dez Bryant was left in disbelief after officials overturned his superb catch late in the fourth quarter of Sunday's playoff loss to the Green Bay Packers.

headline.main: No. 15 Stanford Holds Off Washington State 86-76 in OT
headline.print_headline: No. 15 Stanford Holds Off Washington State 86-76 in OT

headline.main: Ducks and Buckeyes Finally Near the End of 15-Game Campaign
headline.print_headline: Ducks and Buckeyes Finally Near the End of 15-Game Campaign
